name: Todd Addison
text: Did not correct my issue and was very stubborn about listening to what I was saying about it.  After his first surgery I still had same pain in my left hand.  I explained that I felt it was Golf related. I felt I had a broken hamate bone.. he was adamant about blowing me off.  After being released from him, I went to Andrew’s Orthopedic and they confirmed exactly what I thought.  My “Hook of the Hamate” was fractured. Now I’m having surgery to fix what was my issue. What a complete waste of my time he was!

name: Aaron Southern
text: I was referred to Dr. Bonatz for carpal tunnel syndrome. His staff was fantastic. They were able to get me an appointment right away. Dr. Bonatz took his time to make sure every question I had was answered. Their surgery coordinator was able to work me into their surgery schedule within the following week. After the surgery, I was back to work within 3 days, typing on a keyboard all day. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. I am currently scheduling my surgery with my other hand. Definitely check them out!

resp.text: Wow, we appreciate the high praise, Aaron! We're thankful you chose us to be a part of your recovery journey, and we'll be sure to pass along your kind words to everyone involved.

name: Jason Hall
text: I was referred to Dr. Bonatz by my orthopedic surgeon. She had told me that he was one of the best hand surgeons around. I will say that received great care and the surgery went well. Very pleased with the overall experience. He is the best.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Mr. Hall! We're thrilled that you had a great experience with our clinic.

name: Jared Dailey
text: Dr. Bonantz is rude, does not listen, and does not deal with the correct problems.  I went to him with a hand problem and he informed me I am an overweight diabetic,  which I already knew.  He sent his nurse in with papers for bariatric surgery across the hall.  I have a cyst in my hand I need removed.   I'm well aware of my weight problems.   I have to buy my clothes.  No thank you, you rude, self righteous know it all.  He also told me I would die without the covid vaccine,  and he's told multiple other people this.  I would not recommend this "doctor" to anyone. for anytbing

resp.text: Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention, Jared. We at Southlake Orthopaedics hold ourselves to the highest possible standards of patient care, so we are terribly sorry to hear about this experience. Please reach out to me at (205) 985-4111 or email me at mjones@slortho.com so we can better understand the problem and better serve our patients in the future.

name: Kimberli Calma
text: Dr. Bonatz and his staff are amazing! He is brilliant and he has surrounded himself with an amazing knowledgeable and caring team.  Their attentiveness and follow up is amazing and this comes from a patient with an emergency on a Friday that continued over the weekend into the following week.  They did not miss a beat ensuring I have a healthy full functioning hand.  Thank you Thank you!

name: candy j
text: Dr. Bonatz has to be one of the worst doctors I’ve ever seen. My first visit with him was Nov 6 fracture ring finger sprained middle finger. He had me to start Occupational Therapy immediately. My return visit with Dec 8. My range of motion had improved however the strengthening had not even begun. All of my OT were saying the same thing my hand needed further OT because of my job. On Dec 8 2020 Dr. Bonazt entered the room and began talking with the door of the room wide open. I asked if he could close the door while we discussed my injury. His response no because of COVID-19 a violation of my patients rights mind you Dr. Bonazt was not wearing a mask nor gloves so much for concerns. Also, while waiting on him the door was closed the entire time and anyone else that entered closed the door behind them. He ask me what my job title was twice which I’m sure was on my report. He indicated that the fracture was healing pretty good I didn’t need surgery and therefore there was nothing else he could do. I question him because I must be 100% my strength in my hand indicated that I could hold up to13lbs briefly. I asked him for copies of the report he denied me of that also, stating that workman’s comp would have to request it. Forgetting when I visit him the first time he did.  His sarcastic remarks and tone was very belittling. To add insult to injury as he was walking out he says if you break anything else come see me. Unbelievable and Rude he obviously doesn’t care because there’s no repercussions behind his actions.

name: Kaye Byrd
text: Dr. Bonanza and assistants were pleasant, explained procedures, and answered my questions fully.

name: Jane Carson
text: Office staff was very friendly and helpful . Dr Bonatz was on spot and Office was quick to setup the additional testing to verify my issues so that Dr Bonatz could resolve them. I learned about him from a friend w similar probs and she had excellent results. From everything so far,  I’m sure I will have the same excellent results.

name: Marilyn Seier
text: Excellent surgeon and has operated on both wrists and more recently my right hand. He thoroughly explains the diagnosis and the course of action to repair the problem. In case of an emergency like with my hand he saw me right away and planned surgery two days later. My Southlake physical therapist, Cathy, helped me rehab after all 3 surgeries and she is fantastic

name: Bobby Smith
text: Friendly, helpful,great staff, treat you like family.

name: Crystal Watford
text: Dr. Bonatz is professional, personable, and also quick, which I appreciate. He makes sure I understand what he has explained before leaving the room. He's done one surgery on my hand and is about to do another. I have no hesitations.

name: Ruth Black
text: He’s a sadistic man. Don’t go to him!  He hurts you & he allows you to be in excruciating pain after surgery. There are GREAT hand surgeons in Birmingham who have MANNERS and do not enjoy seeing their patients in pain.  One is Dr. Smith. He’s in the same office.

name: Beverly Kirkpatrick
text: Everyone was very friendly & professional. Dr. Bonatz was very thorough & explained everything concerning treatment for my problem. I would definitely recommend to others.

name: Candis Threatt
text: Dr. Bonatz is so straightforward but also very thorough. My son had a broken thumb that most times would require surgery, Dr. Bonatz simply had my son put in a cast and said, "Three weeks!" In exactly three weeks his thumb healed properly and he's back doing what he loves... Playing BASKETBALL! The supporting staff(front desk, nurses, pct, etc) were phenomenal!

name: Staci Rowell
text: Dr Bonatz is brilliant!  He is precise, professional and courteous. Would definitely recommend him to anyone needing hand/wrist treatment.

text: Very pleased with my association with this clinic and Dr. Bonatz. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful, especially the front desk. Dr. Bonatz is warm, kind and careful, double checking the info received from xrays, etc. Should you be in need of this type medical assistance, I highly recommend this clinic.

text: I don't have the knowledge to evaluate my visit based on the medical expertise of the people I saw, but I can talk about the efficiency of the office personnel, the personal respect from everyone I saw (both for patients and for each other), and the overall positive atmosphere there. That was something I liked very much.

name: m mills
text:
First I can not say enough good things about the staff, they were extremely nice and compassionate. But Dr Ekkhard Bonatz is not, he has zero ethics. He told me he would preform surgery on my broken wrist but and I quote "it would not work anyway", DO NOT LET THIS MAN TREAT YOU!
I ask if I could see my break on an x-ray and he brought in a plastic arm, he patted my arm and thanked me because he could pay off his daughters college tuition with my injury. He acted like a pediatrician talking to a child. He refused pain treatment and said he would drink if it were him, again DO NOT LET THIS MAN TREAT YOU!

name: Dale Dixon
text: I was very nervous at first, in past others gave me no hope. Dr.Bonatz gave me the hope I have been looking for. Very kind and attentive. I feel 100% positive now. All staff made it a pleasurable visit. Thank you Dr.Bonatz

text: I would not send my worst enemy to this man. He lied about the procedure,  he lied about the treatment and was upset and told us that if we were to seek a second opinion he would no longer treat. He gave wrong meds when he had pathology report right in front of him . Not a compassionate person and neither is his assistant. Would NOT recommend.

name: Bo Canning
text:
Dr. Bonatz and staff are the most knowledgeable, caring team in Alabama. Dr. Bonatz took the time to answer all my questions during the process of rebuilding my hand. I never felt rushed by him.
His staff were the same way, taking time to discuss the questions you forgot to ask Dr. Bonatz. They are very knowledgeable and very caring.
His P.T. staff are the  and same way, they know their stuff, and are always encouraging you to do your exercises at home.  If you do what they say, you will improve your hand. (They are the best)

text: Hands down one of the best doctors visits ever! Dr. Bonatz put me at ease with his knowledge, straight forward approached with a great dose of humor. His staff was friendly, quick and efficient and I feel like I received the best healthcare. I highly recommend Dr. Bonatz at Southlake Orthopedics

name: Kimberly Snelling
text: Dr Bonatz is least compassionate Dr I have ever had the misfortune to meet! He has no ethics whatsoever. He told my husband he would do surgery on his hand but it probably wouldn't work. He mentioned he needed the money for his daughter s college. He also said he would do the second surgery, he mentioned he wanted to go Spain. He also thanked my husband for fracturing his wrist. If you have hurt yourself and need treatment I wouldn't not recommend Dr. Bonatz. I would not take my dog to him. The staff however were very helpful and compassionate.

resp.text: At Southlake Orthopaedics we certainly sympathize with our patients and the pain they have due to injuries or other conditions.  Very sorry you found your recent visit to be unsatisfactory to the standard you expected.  We are happy to coordinate a second opinion with one of our other Board Certified physicians if you so choose.  Our goal is to improve any conditions we can.

name: DEBRA SMITH
text: Dr. Bonatz and staff gave me excellent care before and after surgery. I couldn't have ask for better treatment.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback!

name: Juandelisha Perry
text: I am so greatful to have met Dr. Bonatz and the staff of Southland  orthopedic. For over 10+ years of  chronic pain I spent years searching for help and  consulting with my primay physican, rheumatologist,  neurologist, osteoarthritis, pain management, and any other specialist.   Unfortunately, they all gave up on me and past me on to the next specialist. Finally, I was referred to, I was Dr. Bonatz.  The frist cosultation, he knew what was wrong, schedule some tests and did not give up on me until he solved the problem.  For the first time in years, I can sleep at night with out pain, go outside during the winter with out pain. Thank you so much!!!

name: C Miller
text: I am due to have surgery with Dr. Bonatz  in the next couple of weeks. So I cannot speak of that experience yet. I can however speak of his Staff which has been wonderful, and informative, as has Dr. Bonatz. I would have given 5 stars except for the fact both times I have been to see him, once at Grandview, the other at the Southlake office, both times I had to wait 20 to 30 minutes past my appointment time. I realize they get busy, however  my time is important as well   My suggestion would be to find a way to improve upon that.  It’s a shame to have an appointment time of 1:15pm and not leave until 3:00.

name: Kassie Luster
text: We had a really good experience with Dr Bonatz. We were very pleased with the care we recieved. My 10 yr old broke her pinky finger and it went into her growth plate. He was very good with her and making the right decision for her care. She was in a custom splint made for just her size for 3 weeks. We went back and he was so nice. Said she was healing nicely. She really liked him alot and would recommend anyone else with smaller children to see him. Staff was really awesome as well. We had not longer than a five min wait time each time we went.

name: Ronald Barksdale
text: Awesome

resp.text: Thanks for the review.

name: Ken Howe
text: Dr. Smith has performed four surgeries on my hands over the past two years. Two carpal tunnel surgeries, one to remove gout related deposits and one To repair a finger which I seriously injured in a saw mishap. Thanks to his skills and a very capable staff I have had fantastic results. I would highly recommend him to anyone in need of hand surgery. Thank you Dr Smith and your great staff!

name: Milton Smith
text: Dr. Smith and his staff are precise and meticulous with their diagnoses. He and the staff were courteous, and  kind in their attitudes toward me. His work has allowed me to be pain free with a very troubling problem.

name: Cindy Thompson
text: Dr. Smith was a wonderful doctor. He did surgery on my thumb and did a great job. I would recommend him if you need a good surgeon. He was very nice and sweet and he set down and talked to me and let me ask questions if I needed to. Just a great doctor. I would definitely go back to him.

resp.text: We appreciate the review, Cindy! We're always happy to hear when we've accomplished our mission of providing 5-star care & service in our clinic.

name: Peggy Morris
text: Dr. Smith is a wonderful, caring doctor.  He diagnosed the issue with my hand, on first visit, and performed surgery. I’m pain-free and able to use it for the first time in months. resp.text: So thrilled to hear about your experience, Peggy! And we're sure Dr. Smith and the rest of his staff will be excited to hear as well. We're lucky to have such a skilled and experienced surgeon as Dr. Smith as a part of the team.

name: Tina Rinehart
text: Dr. Smith is a great doctor. He explains everything to you in a way that you understand what is going on. Him and his staff take every precaution to keep you safe as well. You could not ask for a better doctor and we highly recommend  him to anyone that needs an orthopedic  for their hand /wrist.  Also want to brag on their physical therapy department ladies Cathy and  Rebekah both are awesome and know their stuff.

Love Dr. Smith, he's the best!

text:
Dr. Smith reconstructed my finger after a table saw accident.  Would have never believed that the finger would have ever looked normal again, little lone functional.
His talent as a surgeon is far and above anything I have ever seen in my 60 years.
An honest, direct, extremely dedicated professional that I have highly recommend to everyone I meet in need of hand surgery.

name: Susan Hulsey
text: I stabbed my hand with a knife cutting an avocado.  Dr. Smith repaired the artery and the nerve in the palm of my hand.  I have regained strength in my hand and sensation in my fingers! I would recommend him to anyone for his knowledge, skill and expertise.  By the way, he is also nice!

name: DAVID V
text: This is the second time I used Dr. Smith for surgery - once on my wrist and once on my hand. He is an outstanding doctor from all aspects and expectations. Of all the 11 doctors that I currently using, he has the best technical skills and follow up after the surgery. Just as important, he has great people skills. He honestly cares about his patients and assures that the patient understands all options, all plans for treatment, and a clear path for recovery.  He is a very nice, caring and down to earth gentleman. I STRONGLY recommend Dr. Smith and the staff at Southlake Orthopaedics.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the feedback!

If surgery could be an enjoyable experience, this one was. Follow up visits have been equally impressive. It’s a joy to deal with professionals of this caliber.

In an emergency like mine you just take your chances with the surgeon available & willing to take you on.  With Dr. Smith I won the lottery!

I had my Dr. send a referral to Dr. Barbours office and an appointment was made. All staff was respectful and courteous.  EXCEPT Dr. Barbour. He blew me off and talked down to me,  like a second class citizen. I tried to convey my concerns and was cut off.  "All women have loose joints" ....How disrespectful! I went out of my way to find a good reputable Dr. and just wound up with ANOTHER ARROGANT WASTE OF MY TIME AND MONEY! I  was not there for a prescription, I  was there because I have a problem.  Needless to say my hands are still in pain and now I have to do it all again.
Don't bother with Dr. Barbour. Find someone who ACTUALLY wants to find a solution!

name: Sierra’s Henderson
text: My mom has been suffering from thumb wrist pain for over a year.  We have went to her primary care physician several times.  She has received steroid shots in her thumb, taken ibuprofen,  used a spica splint, iced, rested, and attempted physical therapy and they said it was too swollen to do anything with it at this time.  She then got an X-ray and it said she had bone on bone arthritis.  She doesn’t have insurance, but we have paid cash for all treatments; therefore, her ex-husband volunteered to pay for her to see an orthopedic surgeon and pay for surgery if needed.  I am an ICU nurse and wanted to take her to her appointment because she is medical illiterate and I wanted to see what her options were to be able to help her decide what to do.  During this appointment, the doctor walked in and asked where she was hurting and for how long then told her she had bone on bone arthritis and then stood up like he was going to leave and said “Well do you have any questions.” Nothing was ever explained and no options were ever given.  This is when I spoke up and started asking questions about our options and he ended up giving her a steroid injection and said she would maybe need surgery in the future.  8 days after the injection, her hand is hurting, swollen, with loss of motion again, now I need to make another appointment, but I don’t know if I need to see the same doctor or try to see another doctor due to his lack of concern.  I felt as if she was treated differently because she didn’t have insurance, but I’ve heard raving reviews about Dr.Barbour so maybe he was having an off day and in his defense the office was crazy busy that day.

resp.text: Sierra,  we are sorry we did not meet your expectations. We would like to speak with your mother about her visit if she is available. Please ask her to call our office manager at (251) 450-2766 to discuss your specific issues.

Finally they put me in room and about 5 minutes later dr comes in and reaches for my right hand and says : “so... you having problems with your right wrist “. I said “ uh no it’s the left.  He said , well they said it was your right. Well I spent 10 minutes in waiting room filling out a form and writing my complaints in plain English on the forms. That irritated me. Then the dr just stares at me when I find out that what the cause was . I asked him what I could do to help with the problem since surgery was not an option at this point he just stares at me with this look of you just asked me that. Finally I get my point across then he says do this and this and that and it might help for relief temporarily.then he says ok. Call us if you get worse and walks me out . I go to post check out desk. No one is there waited, then walked out to check in desk out front, no one there and I waited standing there for 5 minutes finally I just left. Didn’t know if there was a copayment but I know I had to get back to work it was 12:15 . I missed 3-1/2 hours of work basically for nothing.

Xrays have been quick and are completed onsite, as is the therapy/rehab office where they made my splint in only minutes. All the staff from check in, rehab, X-ray, PA, nursing, all the way to Dr Mitch have been just the nicest most caring people. name: Angie Jeppesen
text:
I have had many surgeries and experiences with doctors... and I have NEVER been treated that well before! From the moment the pre- op nurse came to get me until I was in recovery with the post-op nurse.... EVERYONE I encountered was very friendly, very careful about my allergies, and gave an overall sense that they CARED about me not as a number on a chart, but as a person. The amount of effort everyone put in to making me feel comfortable and not quite so anxious was a welcome surprise. The constant checking of what I was allergic to was also a tremendous shock! Not only were my allergies noted, but they were monitored very carefully... my voice mattered!! I cannot say enough good things about my experience yesterday. This was an amazing team and I am so thankful to ALL of you for the wonderful care you gave me. If only other doctors, nurses, hospitals, teams, could follow your ways of helping people... we would have a much better world in which to live. THANK YOU.... with all my heart, thank you! Best wishes to all of you!
With most sincere gratitude,
Angie Jeppesen

name: Cynthia Johnson
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible experience! Never in my life have I experienced such harsh treatment from a doctor! Even my first visit with him was horrible! As I attempted to explain my situation to Dr. Rachael he gazed at the wall as If I bored him and even when it seemed as if I had his attention he gave off a very nonchalant attitude. My second visit I left crying because he screamed at me so bad as if I was lying and made my injury up just to get paid under workers comp because he ordered a carpal tunnel test that came back positive be he explained to me the Dr. was wrong who performed the test and that half the people in the lobby would come back positive for carpal tunnel even though they don't have it. My thoughts was why would you test me for carpal tunnel which would include the middle finger, the pointer finger and the thumb only when I have clearly from day one told you my pinky finger and ring finger are numb and painful which would be cubital tunnel. So for his mistake I was scolded like a toddler. He then ordered an MRI which came back schowing a tear in my right wrist on my tfc disk and on top of that an ganglion cyst 16mm by 6 mm that has grown inside my inner wrist. When the results came back he canceled my visit and told his staff to inform me that I need to find another doctor to assist me...WOW IS ALL I CAN SAY!!! All that attitude and harsh treatment and didn't have the nerve to face me because you was wrong all along!!! Humble yourself Dr. Rachael!!!!!! PLEASE BEWARE!!!!

name: artgirl
text: Dr Rachel is by far the worse orthopedic surgeon that my husband had the misfortune to use..mike's ring finger was amputated october 2016....he didnot do a culture on the finger and so his hand became infected...so mike was forced by this so called doctor to spend time at the worse hospital in mobile...providence hospital..rachel told us that they had wonderful wound care specialists there and mike would be taken care of...he said that providence was closer and we would be able to see him more...he was wrong on all counts...i would call his office and talk to his nurse to try and get to see infectious disease and wound care because mike had seen neither..i told someone at their office that i was afraid that mike was going to die there...that ...is how bad it got...i was calling the nurse managers everday of the 10 days we were there...i even confronted dr rachel in the cast room and i told him it was his fault that mike was in the hospital because he could have done a culture and got him on antibiotics sooner...he just looked at me blankly and said ok...ok and then told me he heard me and i said i hope so...mike's amputated finger looks like a butt hole...that is what mike thinks...it is horrible looking...poorly done...and the bandaging of the wound caused another wound that we are still dealing with a year later...mike ended up having that pinkie amputated too...having a ray revision...all because of rachel's incompetence... we quit going to him in december 2016...i don't like him and i am a fair person but i donot trust him...if you need a hand surgeon go to Dr Burkett...he is supposely good...but please don't go to rachel...mike passed away on july 24...2018...i blame rachel as the main one of the doctors to cause his demise...the one to start mike's downward slide...i have gone to dr burkett...he is great...too bad mike didnt go to him instead of horrible rachel...

name: donna youngblood
text: I was having unbearable pain in my shoulder. I had been to a local ER on a Sunday and had been told to see an orthopedic. Monday was a holiday so I called that hospitals ortho office Tuesday morning. They could not see me until the following Monday. I couldn’t wait that long so I decided to try Andrews Sports Med. They got me into the office the next day.  I saw Dr. Rachel Henderson. She was excellent! They took X-rays and did an MRI that same day. The office called me will the MRI results later that same day! Then the next morning, the outpatient office called me to schedule a nerve block which I had the next day! All this happened within 3 days of calling their office! I have never had to see an orthopedic doc before nor have ever had a nerve block so I was nervous. I can’t say enough about everyone I encountered at the offices. If this happens again I will not be nervous. I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine. I’ll never go anywhere else.

name: William Somar
text: Reputable surgery center but I felt like a number. Visited at the recommendation of my physical therapist for a shoulder issue. When I got to the lobby I could tell this place is set up for mass production: there were check-in kiosks like at the airport and a bunch of people waiting. When I was called the first time, it was to pay. When I was called the second time, I was led to a second  waiting room with no explanation. The third time I was led to an x-ray room where I found out I was getting x-rays. Surprise! Eventually, I was led to an examination room. No vitals were taken. I waited. Eventually, a doctor - not the one I had the appointment with - showed up and immediately started to discuss scheduling surgery without examination. He discussed two procedures - the second one was news to me. When I inquired, he then tested my range of motion to confirm what he had seen in the tests. I expressed doubts about the second procedure and he left to get the originally-scheduled doctor. After nearly 30 minutes, they both came back. The second (scheduled) doctor explained why he recommended the second procedure as a preemptive option. He did a good job of explaining the surgery and recovery. He left and the first doctor took me to a scheduler. Everyone I interacted with was cordial and professional. I never saw my x-rays nor the MRI I had brought with me. I realize this place is good and they have a lot of people to get to. I known they are all fine surgeons. But still, I felt like one more item to check off on their to-do list. I still have unanswered  questions and it is ironic that being there for 2.5 hours and waiting most of the time, that I felt rushed when it came to the consultation. In summary, one of the best places for surgery, but don't expect "the personal touch."

resp.text: Thank you for your candid response. We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients. Please feel free to call us at (205) 581-7128 if you would like to discuss.

name: UofAlabamaFan
text: Andrews Sports Medicine has THE BEST DOCTORS.  They are professional, but very personable and approachable.  You never feel like they are in a hurry to see you and get you out of the office.  My family and I have seen four different doctors at Andrews for a variety of problems, and each has had a very successful outcome.  They were surgical, had no problems at all, and are as good as new now.  I have also seen the non-surgical doctors and they are great as well.  They know what they are doing, and do it better than any other doctor.  One family member went to an orthopaedic doctor here in Tuscaloosa several times for a problem with her foot.  He had no idea what was wrong or how to treat her, but he did give her steroid injections a couple of times hoping that would help the problem - it didn't help.  We told her to go to Andrews!  She was able to get a new patient appointment within several days, the doctor saw her, knew exactly what the problem was, performed surgery, and she never had any problems with her foot again.  My family and I highly recommend Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedic Center!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your trust in our practice and for taking the time to share your family's experience with our team of doctors. We realize you have many choices and we appreciate your trust in our team!

name: Kenneth Byrd
text:
If I could give it a negative star, I would. My wife went to Dr. Henderson for 10 out of 10 pain in her right foot, unable to sleep due to pain and inability to walk on it. After a two hour wait, she was seen, by Dr. Henderson, which was weird because appointments were available all day?  She was condescending, said pain is being caused by a callous on the bottom of her foot and that a pumice stone would take care of it. Then my wife proceeded to take off her other shoe and stated " why isn't the callous hurting this foot." Dr. then said, well, maybe it is a bunion. No X-ray, no nothing.

Fast forward two days later, we are getting an X-ray and getting a second opinion. Come to find out it is a severe impact injury with bone growth (Spur) and needs surgery to remove. Dr. we obtained a second opinion from stated he makes his living off of people coming to him from Andrews with misdiagnosis or lack of adequate care.

resp.text: We’re so sorry that this was the case. Your experience was not consistent with the type of care we aim to provide for our patients.

name: John Pointon
text: I chose Andrews for total hip replacement a year ago after research online and personal recommendations from prior patients. I couldn't be more satisfied. Yes, they're busy - not surprising considering their reputation - but they are much more efficient than most medical practices struggling with all the usual issues: insurance; billing; scheduling; non-user friendly EMR systems; HIPAA; etc. etc. All aspects of the process - scheduling, pre-op briefing, surgery and post-op care were first rate. The surgeon took time to explain pros/cons and expectations clearly, and answer questions. Back on my feet in no time. Follow up during the year has been excellent and the procedure was transformative. Recently hiked extensive distances over rough, hilly terrain with no discomfort - fantastic!

name: Tom Jenkyn
text:
As a disabled vet, I've had more than my fair share of orthopedic problems and surgeries. I had the good fortune to have Dr Steven R. Nichols perform multiple surgeries on my spine. Yes, they were different problems at different locations. He was recommended to me by friends in Sports Medicine at the University where I worked.

The first was a neck fusion, about 10 years ago. I was without pain, discharged, and went home the same day. Ten days after surgery I drove non-stop from Meridian, Mississippi to San Antonio, Texas. Last July he performed Lumbar Laminectomy surgery and removed the debris and spurs that were causing numbness in both legs and prohibited me from standing up straight. Again, discharged the same day, feeling returned to both legs and walking as the Good Lord intended.  There is not another Doctor on the planet I would allow to cut on my spine than Dr. Nichols.

His professionalism exemplifies what Andrews Sports Medicine stands for.  My family and I were always given  the same care and concern as the professional athletes they have become famous for treating. Simple logic dictates that if world class professional athletes with unlimited resources, who depend on their bodies performing at the level they do, seek out his services, it must be top notch. I have recommended him to friends and will continue to do so. If I didn't recommend him, it would be as though I didn't care about people who are an important part of my life.

text: Andrews Sports Medicine and Orthopaedics Center is a very busy place but it is run like a well oiled machine. I’ve never had to sit in the waiting room more than a few short minutes. Several friends recommended Dr. Sam Goldstein to me and I wasn’t disappointed.  Dr. Goldstein listened to me patiently, had my MRI done on the spot and gave me results that same day. My injury is still healing but I’m getting there.

name: Brookelynne Mathews
text:
My husband had major foot /ankle surgery with Dr.Waldrop. He had all tendons repaired, his heel was moved over, the archilles tendon cut and lengthened!  It has been Over a year of being off work and unable to walk/stand or wear steel toe boots tk return to work . No matter how much we told this man that my husband IS in pain he did NOTHING except a few x-rays that NEVER show anything. It took an MRI and nerve test in the beginning BEFORE surgery to even find the problem. Not once did Dr. Waldrop order a MRI or nerve test!!  We had to insist on a referral to see a Pain management doctor because after two months he felt my husband didn't need pain meds.
The only thing  Dr. Waldrop would say is "Umm, I see". Never did any test after surgery except an X-ray, and we believe that's because he knows my husbands foot is worse after his surgery.
My husbands long term disability with his company has now been stopped due to Dr. Waldrops opinion that he can return to work WHEN HE CANNOT!!!
If you use this man make sure you get in writing from him BEFORE leaving his office if you can't return to work. !!

name: Carla LeFan
text:
I have been seeing Dr McKeon for the past five or six years at least. I have an a 63 year old female, who worked as a Pipefitter/Welder and with tiny parts as an industrial sewing mechanic, before retiring. I have always been a big diy person at home. I have suffered much pain from the tendons in in my joints. Mainly trigger fingers, where they lock down and become too painful to pull back up. Therefore, becoming useless for everyday life. Thankfully I was referred to Dr. McKeon.

My first encounter with this awesome lady was with my grandson, whose thumb kept dislocating. Dr. McKeon suggested we wait and allow growth  plates to grow properly, with hopes that he would outgrow it. He indeed has outgrown the condition. Although Dr. McKeon wasn’t the first to operate on these lock downs, she is my choice every time.

My last surgery was at the Birmingham Surgery Center, in Homewood. I often describe it, as much like going to a dental appointment. Dr. McKeon is always so friendly and full of joy. I’m positive she’s human and occasionally has a, not so good day, but you would never know it, when she appears. During surgery she and I had a question and answer session during the surgical procedure. Her coworkers seem to adore her also.

In conclusion, if you’re looking for a 5 star doctor for your hands, and awesome bedside manner is of importance to you, Dr. McKeon is your woman.

name: kelley bland
text: I broke my wrist at the gym at 5am and went to the ER immediately after it happened. The orthopaedic surgeon that the ER doctor suggested never returned my calls, and still hasn't. I was in horrible pain and started researching orthopaedic surgeons in the area. Not only were Dr. McKeon's online reviews great, but she is part of the Andrews Sports Medicine group, which is known worldwide for treating professional athletes' injuries. I knew it was a longshot to get an appointment within a few days, but I called anyway. Her staff agreed to see me and told me to come to their office right then! I was prepared to wait hours once I got there since they worked me into the schedule, but I did not mind. Nope! I was called back, had xrays done and was meeting with Dr. McKeon within about 15 minutes. She was straightforward, went over my xrays and injury and said I'd require surgery. She explained the entire procedure and said she performed 100+ of this type surgery in a year. She got me scheduled for surgery THE next morning and made me feel so much better about the procedure. Surgery went great and I am recovering nicely. I cannot say enough great things about Dr. McKeon and her entire staff! They are prompt, knowledgeable, compassionate and caring...everyone I dealt with has been fantastic through this entire process.

text: Dr McKeon did my right hand carpel tunnel surgery. I opted for just the local numbing agent instead of Anesthesia so I was able to talk and joke with her and her staff during the surgery. This also allowed me to quickly leave post opperation with none of the side effects that anesthesia leaves. I followed how she told me to keep it elevated and iced and only had to use one pain pill and was good to go after. She did a great job with a very small  insertion. All of the pain and numbness (yes I know how can you have pain and numbness at the same time but if you have carpel tunnel you understand) have gone away and no further issues. If fixing to have her fix the carpel tunnel in my left hand in a couple of weeks. My wife checked out her academic and medical records and was highly impressed. Not only is she a great surgeon but has an outstanding mind as well as a great sense of humor. You won’t get to see the sene of humor in the office as she is very professional but if opt for the local anesthetic  you’ll see how well her and her staff have fun. All of the nurses I spoke with also thought very highly of her which in and of itself tells you all you need to know.

name: Lydia Brooks
text: I went to Dr. McKeon about pain, numbness, and tingling in my left (dominant) hand and wrist. She diagnosed me with carpal tunnel which was confirmed by a nerve conduction test. At the first visit she wanted to give me a steroid injection but I told her because of health issues my Rheumatologist recommended I not take them. She said it was a local injection and not systemic but I reiterated I could not do it. She was very annoyed I would not get the injection. When I asked her what else I could do for the pain she said there was nothing else I could do for it. I did my own research and started getting massages, acupuncture, and did essential oils. I went back for a second visit and she was nicer and seemed a little more concerned about me since I was still in so much pain. At this point the pain had started shooting up my arm. She said to try hand therapy for a couple of weeks and if that didn't help we could discuss surgery. I did therapy which still did not improve my condition and went back to her for a third visit. This time Dr. McKeon flat out refused to discuss surgery. She dismissed all the notes the hand therapist had sent her and told me she felt like I had mild carpal tunnel and the pain I was having was caused by the hand brace I had been wearing and it was a completely different nerve causing the pain. The pain had not changed and the brace actually made it more tolerable. She told me to stop wearing the brace during the day and only wear it while I slept. She then gave me two doctors' names if I wanted a second opinion. At this point I was crying because I was so frustrated she was not willing to discuss surgery. I did go for a independent second opinion but not to the doctors she recommended. I have an anesthesiologist friend who recommended a hand orthopedist he worked with. I was able to get in to see that orthopedist the next day. This doctor was the total opposite of Dr. McKeon. He listened to me and had compassion for the pain I had been living with for months. He said I had tried all other measures and at this point surgery was the best option to get rid of the pain. I had carpal tunnel release surgery the next week. It is a very simple out patient surgery that takes about 15 minutes. When I woke up from the surgery 100% of the pain, numbness, and tingling was gone. I wished I had gone to the second doctor months before I did but was willing to give Dr. McKeon a chance when she said we could discuss surgery if I did the therapy and that didn't help.
